translated: “What he sees he does not want,

analyzed: yam ca na passati tam kiricchati
translated: What he does not see he wants;

original: Maññāmi ciraṁ carissati,🔽Na hi taṁ lacchati yaṁ sa icchati.🔽Yaṁ labhati na tena tussati,
analyzed: maññāmi ciram carissati  na hi tam lacchati yam saḥ icchati  yam labhati na tena tussati
translated: I think he will wander for a long time,🔽For he will not get what he wants.🔽What he gets he is not satisfied with,

analyzed: yat ca pattha iti laddham hīḍā iti
translated: What he seeks he despises when he gets it;
For desire has an endless range,

analyzed: vigati chāna namaḥ karomasa iti 🔽vigati cha jātakam
translated: We pay homage to those who have overcome desire.”🔽The Birth Story of Vigaticcha (The Fourth)
